BackstoryDef.title: scarlet crusader
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] waged war against the shamblers—cursed undead that mocked the purity of life. \nWith fire and steel, [PAWN_pronoun] struck them down, seeking to cleanse the world of their corruption.

BackstoryDef.title: scarlet purifier
BackstoryDef.description: Where others sought to heal, [PAWN_nameDef] sought to burn. [PAWN_possessive] order rose in the wake of a terrible plague—one that did not simply kill, but reanimated the dead. No corpse could be left intact, no grave unguarded. Fire was their weapon, purity their creed. \n[PAWN_nameDef] did not fight to protect the living, but to deny the dead. In time, the order perished, but the fire has not gone out. Wherever death lingers, [PAWN_pronoun] still watches.

BackstoryDef.title: scarlet defender
BackstoryDef.description: For years, [PAWN_nameDef] and [PAWN_possessive] brethren stood unbroken, burning back every wave of the dead. \nBut faith alone does not hold walls. The order did not fall in battle; it drowned in its own dead. [PAWN_nameDef] alone escaped, wading through fire and ruin. And if the order is gone, if the sanctuary is lost—what else remains, except the duty to burn?

BackstoryDef.title: scarlet bishop
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] once stood at the pulpit, robed in crimson, preaching fire and purity. [PAWN_possessive] voice a weapon, stirring armies to burn the dead and cleanse the unworthy. Where others gave comfort, [PAWN_pronoun] gave purpose—to end the curse of reanimation. \n[PAWN_nameDef]'s order fell, but the fire remains. And as long as [PAWN_pronoun] draws breath, it will spread.

BackstoryDef.title: noble’s dog
BackstoryDef.description: Once, [PAWN_nameDef] was caught in an oil fire that left half of [PAWN_possessive] body a ruin of charred flesh. Marked by pain and scorned by common folk, [PAWN_pronoun] found an unlikely refuge in the service of a ruthless noble family. It was a cruel but privileged station—better than most in [PAWN_possessive] position could ever hope for. More than the coin, it gave [PAWN_objective] something no one would have expected: a glimpse of refinement. Among the immaculate and the untouchable, [PAWN_pronoun] almost forgot the melted ruin of [PAWN_possessive] own face. \nBrutality came easy—obedience even easier. But years of bloodshed hollowed [PAWN_objective] out, leaving only bitterness and a thirst that no drink could quench. Now, [PAWN_pronoun] staggers through life, fueled by ale and a smoldering hatred for those who wield fire.
